member.name: M:Quartz.PluginConfigurationExtensions.UseJobAutoInterrupt``1(``0,System.Action{Quartz.JobAutoInterruptOptions})
member.summary: Configures into use.

member.name: P:Quartz.JobAutoInterruptOptions.DefaultMaxRunTime
member.summary: The amount of time the job is allowed to run before job interruption is signaled. Defaults to 5 minutes.
member.remarks: Per-job value can be configured via JobDataMap via key .

member.name: T:Quartz.Plugin.History.LoggingJobHistoryPlugin
member.summary: Logs a history of all job executions (and execution vetoes).

remarks.para: The logged message is customizable by setting one of the following message properties to a string that conforms to the syntax of .

JobToBeFiredMessage - available message data are:
Element Data Type Description
0 String The Job's Name.
1 String The Job's Group.
2 Date The current time.
3 String The Trigger's name.
4 String The Trigger's group.
5 Date The scheduled fire time.
6 Date The next scheduled fire time.
7 Integer The re-fire count from the JobExecutionContext.
The default message text is "Job {1}.{0} fired (by trigger {4}.{3}) at: {2:HH:mm:ss MM/dd/yyyy}"

JobSuccessMessage - available message data are:
Element Data Type Description
0 String The Job's Name.
1 String The Job's Group.
2 Date The current time.
3 String The Trigger's name.
4 String The Trigger's group.
5 Date The scheduled fire time.
6 Date The next scheduled fire time.
7 Integer The re-fire count from the JobExecutionContext.
8 Object The string value (toString() having been called) of the result (if any) that the Job set on the JobExecutionContext, with on it. "NULL" if no result was set.
The default message text is "Job {1}.{0} execution complete at {2:HH:mm:ss MM/dd/yyyy} and reports: {8}"

JobFailedMessage - available message data are:
Element Data Type Description
0 String The Job's Name.
1 String The Job's Group.
2 Date The current time.
3 String The Trigger's name.
4 String The Trigger's group.
5 Date The scheduled fire time.
6 Date The next scheduled fire time.
7 Integer The re-fire count from the JobExecutionContext.
8 String The message from the thrown JobExecution Exception.
The default message text is "Job {1}.{0} execution failed at {2:HH:mm:ss MM/dd/yyyy} and reports: {8}"

JobWasVetoedMessage - available message data are:
Element Data Type Description
0 String The Job's Name.
1 String The Job's Group.
2 Date The current time.
3 String The Trigger's name.
4 String The Trigger's group.
5 Date The scheduled fire time.
6 Date The next scheduled fire time.
7 Integer The re-fire count from the JobExecutionContext.
The default message text is "Job {1}.{0} was vetoed. It was to be fired (by trigger {4}.{3}) at: {2:HH:mm:ss MM/dd/yyyy}"

member.author: Marko Lahma (.NET)

member.name: P:Quartz.Plugin.History.LoggingJobHistoryPlugin.JobSuccessMessage
member.summary: Get or sets the message that is logged when a Job successfully completes its execution.

member.summary: Get or sets the message that is logged when a Job fails its execution.

member.summary: Gets or sets the message that is logged when a Job is about to Execute.

member.name: P:Quartz.Plugin.History.LoggingJobHistoryPlugin.JobWasVetoedMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the message that is logged when a Job execution is vetoed by a trigger listener.

member.summary: Get the name of the .

member.summary:
Called by the when a is about to be executed (an associated has occurred).
This method will not be invoked if the execution of the Job was vetoed by a .

member.name: M:Quartz.Plugin.History.LoggingJobHistoryPlugin.JobWasExecuted(Quartz.IJobExecutionContext,Quartz.JobExecutionException,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Called by the after a has been executed, and be for the associated 's method has been called.

member.summary: Called by the when a was about to be executed (an associated has occurred), but a vetoed it's execution.

member.name: T:Quartz.Plugin.History.LoggingTriggerHistoryPlugin
member.summary: Logs a history of all trigger firings.

remarks.para: The logged message is customizable by setting one of the following message properties to a string that conforms to the syntax of .

TriggerFiredMessage - available message data are:
Element Data Type Description
0 String The Trigger's Name.
1 String The Trigger's Group.
2 Date The scheduled fire time.
3 Date The next scheduled fire time.
4 Date The actual fire time.
5 String The Job's name.
6 String The Job's group.
7 Integer The re-fire count from the JobExecutionContext.
The default message text is "Trigger {1}.{0} fired job {6}.{5} at: {4, date, HH:mm:ss MM/dd/yyyy}"

TriggerMisfiredMessage - available message data are:
Element Data Type Description
0 String The Trigger's Name.
1 String The Trigger's Group.
2 Date The scheduled fire time.
3 Date The next scheduled fire time.
4 Date The actual fire time. (the time the misfire was detected/handled)
5 String The Job's name.
6 String The Job's group.
The default message text is "Trigger {1}.{0} misfired job {6}.{5} at: {4, date, HH:mm:ss MM/dd/yyyy}. Should have fired at: {3, date, HH:mm:ss MM/dd/yyyy}"

TriggerCompleteMessage - available message data are:
Element Data Type Description
0 String The Trigger's Name.
1 String The Trigger's Group.
2 Date The scheduled fire time.
3 Date The next scheduled fire time.
4 Date The job completion time.
5 String The Job's name.
6 String The Job's group.
7 Integer The re-fire count from the JobExecutionContext.
8 Integer The trigger's resulting instruction code.
9 String A human-readable translation of the trigger's resulting instruction code.
The default message text is "Trigger {1}.{0} completed firing job {6}.{5} at {4, date, HH:mm:ss MM/dd/yyyy} with resulting trigger instruction code: {9}"

member.author: James House
Marko Lahma (.NET)

member.summary:
Called by the when a has fired, and it's associated is about to be executed.
It is called before the method of this interface.
member.param: The that will be passed to the 's method.

member.name: M:Quartz.Plugin.History.LoggingTriggerHistoryPlugin.TriggerMisfired(Quartz.ITrigger,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Called by the when a has misfired.
Consideration should be given to how much time is spent in this method, as it will affect all triggers that are misfiring. If you have lots of triggers misfiring at once, it could be an issue it this method does a lot.

member.summary: Called by the when a has fired, it's associated has been executed, and it's method has been called.
member.param: The that was passed to the 's method.
The result of the call on the 's method.

member.name: T:Quartz.Plugin.Interrupt.JobInterruptMonitorPlugin
member.summary: This plugin catches the event of job running for a long time (more than the configured max time) and tells the scheduler to "try" interrupting it if enabled.
member.author: Rama Chavali
Marko Lahma (.NET)

member.name: P:Quartz.Plugin.Interrupt.JobInterruptMonitorPlugin.DefaultMaxRunTime
member.summary: The amount of time the job is allowed to run before job interruption is signaled. Defaults to 5 minutes.

member.name: T:Quartz.Plugin.Xml.XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin
member.summary: This plugin loads XML file(s) to add jobs and schedule them with triggers as the scheduler is initialized, and can optionally periodically scan the file for changes.
member.remarks: The periodically scanning of files for changes is not currently supported in a clustered environment.
member.author: James House
Pierre Awaragi

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Quartz.Plugin.Xml.XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin.FileNames
member.summary: Comma separated list of file names (with paths) to the XML files that should be read.

member.name: P:Quartz.Plugin.Xml.XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin.ScanInterval
member.summary: The interval at which to scan for changes to the file. If the file has been changed, it is re-loaded and parsed. The default value for the interval is 0, which disables scanning.

member.name: P:Quartz.Plugin.Xml.XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin.FailOnFileNotFound
member.summary: Whether or not initialization of the plugin should fail (throw an exception) if the file cannot be found. Default is .

member.name: P:Quartz.Plugin.Xml.XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin.FailOnSchedulingError
member.summary: Whether or not starting of the plugin should fail (throw an exception) if the file cannot be handled. Default is .

member.summary: Called when the associated is started, in order to let the plug-in know it can now make calls into the scheduler if it needs to.

member.name: M:Quartz.Plugin.Xml.XMLSchedulingDataProcessorPlugin.BuildJobTriggerName(System.String)
member.summary: Helper method for generating unique job/trigger name for the file scanning jobs (one per FileJob). The unique names are saved in jobTriggerNameSet.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices2.InlineArrayAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the instance's storage is sequentially replicated "length" times.

remarks.para: This attribute can be used to annotate a type with a single field. The runtime will replicate that field in the actual type layout as many times as is specified.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices2.InlineArrayAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance with the specified length.
member.param: The number of sequential fields to replicate in the inline array type.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices2.InlineArrayAttribute.Length
member.summary: Gets the number of sequential fields to replicate in the inline array type.
